title: Manage conflict

hero.oneLineHook: Project management = problem management. Conflicts happen daily‚Äîyour job is preventing escalation, not eliminating disagreement.

framework.frameworkDescription: When you see a conflict question on the exam:

steps.label: Interpret
steps.description: What's the SOURCE? What STAGE of escalation (1-5)?

framework.additionalContent:
5 Levels of Conflict:

  • Level 1 üü¢ Information sharing

Intervene early‚Äîescalation makes resolution exponentially harder!

scenario.scenarioText: You're managing a software project. Two senior developers, Bob and Jane, are in a heated disagreement about which programming methodology to use. The conflict started during sprint planning and has now escalated‚Äîvoices are raised and other team members feel uncomfortable.

options.A: Research both methodologies yourself and decide which is best, then inform the team
options.B: Meet with Bob privately to understand his perspective and implement his solution if it makes sense
options.C: Meet with Jane privately since she has more experience, then make a decision
options.D: Bring Bob and Jane together for a face-to-face discussion to collaboratively find a solution

explanation.whyCorrect: Option D is inclusive‚Äîit involves ALL parties in the solution. PMI values servant leadership and collaboration. The team should solve their own problems with your facilitation, not have solutions imposed.
explanation.whyWrong: A excludes both team members from the decision. B and C each exclude one person, violating the inclusiveness principle. Making decisions FOR the team instead of WITH the team is never the PMI way.
explanation.keyPrinciple: Servant leadership + Inclusive collaboration. When in doubt, bring people together.

mindset.alwaysChoice: Inclusive solutions that involve ALL parties in finding the answer
mindset.neverChoice: Making decisions alone, excluding stakeholders, or choosing sides
mindset.oneLinerRule: When in doubt, bring people together.

questions: Can I name the 3 steps of the I.S.E. framework?
